newsitem.title: USA: Wilmington, Del. mayor outlines revenue share plan.
newsitem.headline: Wilmington, Del. mayor outlines revenue share plan.

text.p: Wilmington, Del., Mayor James Sills has proposed legislation for a revenue sharing system from the state's personal income tax.
Speaking at a Wilmington Rotary Club meeting, Sills called for the passage of the Delaware Financial Partnership Act, also known as Senate Bill 146.
Under the proposed legislation, Wilmington would receive nearly $3 million out of a total of $15 million taken from the state's personal income tax fund.
